title: ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
description:
I am using 1.1rc1. This is a regression since rc1 and a deviation from javac. I am guessing this may have to do something with change in the underlying Eclipse compiler.

To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a class in a subpackage such as:

package subpackage;

public class Test {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello");
    }
}

2. Compile the class using the command:

ajc subpackage\Test.java

Observed Behavior (OB):
After compilation, the test.class file is put in a subpackage\subpackage directory.

Running the java command results in an exception:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test

This behavior can also be observed when using the javac command.

Expected Behavior (EB):
The test.class file should be put in the existing subpackage directory, not in a subsubpackage directory.

Steps to Reproduce (SR):
Use the following command to fix the problem:

ajc -d . subpackage\Test.java
